column5: Hi All, Wow what a weekend! I just wanted to thank you all for coming out and saying hello. I was blowen away buy the crowds at my seminar's and all the signings after! You guys rock! I wish I had more time to hang out with you all at the meet and greet. But the short time we had was great. I say we make this a tradition who knows maybe I can turn the corner of the booth into a bar!!  Once again thank you ALL for your support as always!  Pete thanks for the hat it will hang in my office in a place of honor!  Take Care everyone  Dave Mercer
It was short but sweet... dont put a bar there.. ill never leave....
Oh great! Everyone's beginning to look like Minnie Pearl.  I'm sorry I just couldn't get there. Sounds like you guys had a famous time of it.

hahah It was great to meet ya Dave.( Im the one you hit in the junk with your lure during saturdays seminar hahah).....The turn out to your seminar was awsome. Ill be sure not to pick up any yellow minnow buckets I happen to see floating on the waters. haha  I was a little dissapointed I didnt get to meet many more OFC'ers... the wife was getting a little anxious so we left just before 1 ..
great meeting you dave...thanks for the sub card and signed shirt, and next time bring an extra rod to sell me!   he wouldnt part with the one he had!~
Great to spend some time with you Dave  You look darn good in that pink furry hat dude!
Thanks for the Subway card Dave much appreciated  Boy you sure were a busy guy with all those autographs.  Was a short chat but its always good  Keep up the good work!
With all the money tied up at the  fishing show you would think they could spend some money and get a real celebrity like Charlie Moore!!  LOL
Hey Dave...great to meet and chat with you!  From the "guy who did that song"....LOL.
Didn't get the chance to get down there to meet you. Maybe next time around. You show real class by thanking the gang here. No wonder you are so popular. Keep up the good work.
Thanks for your great seminar and for the meet and greet.  Great work you do with your Casting for a Cure. Many thanks and hats off.  Dirk
